meta.source_summary: Plan derived from the conversation about replacing VS Codeâ€™s terminal with a Python GUI using a real PTY/ConPTY backend, adding signal controls, safe argv handling, minimal VT100 support, a headless parity test harness, hardened quick-actions, and operator polish for the repo DICKY1987/cli_multi_rapid_DEV.
assumptions: Python 3.10+ is available on developer and CI machines.
Windows uses ConPTY via pywinpty; POSIX uses pty/ptyprocess.
Headless GUI test server binds to localhost and a fixed port.
CI will run on ubuntu-latest and windows-latest GitHub-hosted runners.
Lint/format tools are acceptable: ruff and black.
uncertainties: Exact default branch name may differ (main vs master).
File/module names for the terminal widget may vary (cli_gui_terminal.py vs pty_terminal_runner.py).
Quick Actions data model may require fields beyond command_preview.
Windows Ctrl-C semantics may require GenerateConsoleCtrlEvent instead of writing 0x03.
Ports for headless server and parity harness (e.g., 45454/45455) may differ in the repo.
Requirements file name may be requirements.txt or pyproject.toml.

phases.name: Replace pipes with real PTY/ConPTY and wire resize
phases.objective: Ensure GUI sessions run in a real TTY with correct colors, interactive prompts, isatty=True, and responsive resizing.
entry_conditions: Repo cloned locally and branch created from main.
exit_criteria: Resize reflects in TUIs (e.g., top, vim) without redraw artifacts.
Exit codes propagate to the GUI status line.

tasks.instructions: Add cross-platform TTY dependencies. Prefer pyproject.toml; if absent, use requirements.txt. Include: ptyprocess (POSIX), pywinpty (Windows), psutil (optional for process mgmt).
tasks.commit_message: chore(deps): add ptyprocess/pywinpty for real TTY backend

tests.command:
python - <<'PY'
import importlib, sys
mods=['pty','os','select']
missing=[m for m in mods if not importlib.util.find_spec(m)]
print('OK' if not missing else f'MISSING:{missing}')
PY

tasks.instructions: Refactor the spawn path to use pty (POSIX) or ConPTY (Windows) with stdin/stdout wired to the GUI. Preserve exit-code propagation and isatty=True in the child.
tasks.commit_message: refactor(pty): unify POSIX pty and Windows ConPTY spawn path

tests.command:
python - <<'PY'
import sys, os
print('isatty?', os.isatty(1))
PY

tasks.instructions: Hook GUI resizeEvent to compute colsÃ—rows from font metrics and call resize_pty(cols, rows). Verify TUIs redraw correctly.
tasks.commit_message: fix(gui): wire resizeEvent to PTY window size (colsÃ—rows)

tests.command: python gui_test_server.py & sleep 2 && python parity_test_harness.py --case resize && pkill -f gui_test_server.py || true

phases.name: Signal palette and safe argv handling
phases.objective: Add Ctrl-C/EOF/kill controls and robust quoting using shlex to prevent shell=True glitches.
entry_conditions: Real PTY spawn path in place.
exit_criteria: Quoted args pass intact to child processes.
Signal buttons deliver expected behavior on POSIX; best-effort on Windows.

tasks.instructions: Replace naive .split() with shlex.split(posix = sys.platform != 'win32'). Maintain argv list through spawn; avoid shell=True by default.
tasks.commit_message: fix(argv): switch to shlex.split and pass argv list to spawn

tasks.instructions: Implement Ctrl-C, EOF (Ctrl-D/Ctrl-Z), and Kill buttons. On POSIX send SIGINT/SIGHUP/SIGTERM; on Windows attempt 0x03 or GenerateConsoleCtrlEvent if supported.
tasks.commit_message: feat(signals): add Ctrl-C/EOF/Kill controls with cross-platform fallbacks

tests.command: python gui_test_server.py & sleep 2 && python parity_test_harness.py --case ctrl_c && pkill -f gui_test_server.py || true

steps: Guard buttons behind a config toggle and default to off if issues arise.

phases.name: Minimum viable VT100/ANSI handling
phases.objective: Implement CR overwrite, backspace, and CSI K erase-to-EOL for correct line rendering.
exit_criteria: CSI K clears to EOL without residual text.

tasks.instructions: Extend display layer to handle carriage return () overwrite, backspace ( ), and CSI K (ESC [ n K) with n in {0,1,2}.
tasks.commit_message: feat(ansi): support CR, backspace, and CSI K in terminal renderer

tests.command: python gui_test_server.py & sleep 2 && python parity_test_harness.py --case ansi_min && pkill -f gui_test_server.py || true

steps: Add config flag to disable custom ANSI handling and fall back to raw text.

phases.name: Headless GUI parity test harness
phases.objective: Drive the GUI PTY headlessly, assert signals/ANSI/exit codes, and save raw PTY captures to artifacts.
entry_conditions: Basic ANSI and signal handling implemented.
exit_criteria: Parity harness asserts isatty==True, CR/backspace/CSI K behaviors, exit codes, and signal handling.
Raw PTY session logs stored under artifacts/ with timestamps.

tasks.instructions: Expose HTTP/WebSocket endpoints to spawn PTY sessions and stream raw bytes. Add option to save captures to artifacts/.
tasks.commit_message: feat(test-server): expose PTY endpoints and artifact capture for parity tests

tasks.instructions: Drive headless server, execute cases: resize, ansi_min, ctrl_c, exit_codes, unicode. Save raw PTY logs and summaries.
tasks.commit_message: test(parity): add e2e cases (resize, ansi_min, ctrl_c, exit_codes, unicode) with PTY captures

tests.command: python gui_test_server.py & sleep 2 && python parity_test_harness.py --all && pkill -f gui_test_server.py || true

steps: Introduce --skip flags in the harness to bypass failing cases temporarily.

tasks.instructions: Add GitHub Actions to run lint, format check, unit, and parity harness on ubuntu-latest and windows-latest.
tasks.commit_message: chore(ci): add cross-platform lint, unit, and parity harness workflow

phases.name: Harden Quick Actions pipeline
phases.objective: Always show an exact argv command preview pre-run; avoid hidden flags and shell quoting issues.
exit_criteria: Quick Actions render exact argv preview strings.
No hidden flags are injected at runtime.

tasks.instructions: Add command_preview to each action; render it in the GUI before execution; require user confirmation.
tasks.commit_message: feat(quick-actions): add explicit command_preview with confirm-before-run

tests.command:
python - <<'PY'
import json
qa=json.load(open('quick_actions.json'))
print(all('command_preview' in x for x in qa.get('actions', [])))
PY

steps: If preview breaks, hide UI element but continue storing preview in logs.

phases.objective: Expose 'Open in system terminal here' and add status strip (cwd/shell/venv/rowsÃ—cols).

Status strip shows live shell and terminal geometry.

exit_criteria: Lint/format checks pass locally and in CI.

conversion_guidance.mapping_notes: Each phase maps to an epic; each task maps to an issue or GitHub Action step. Tasks with action=configure_ci/create_file/modify_file can be converted to PRs with file diffs. run_command tasks convert to GitHub Actions run steps.

errors: Confirm default branch name before running automated PRs.
Verify actual file paths for terminal widget and headless server.
Decide and document the exact ports used by gui_test_server and parity harness.
Select and pin dependency versions in requirements.txt or pyproject.toml.
Windows Ctrl-C behavior may require GenerateConsoleCtrlEvent and a console process group.
